text: I, Curmudgeon is a 2004 documentary film by Alan Zweig about curmudgeons, himself included. Self-declared curmudgeons interviewed in the film also include Harvey Pekar, Fran Lebowitz, Mark Eitzel, Cintra Wilson, Bruce La Bruce, Andy Rooney and Scott Thompson. The film was shot with a camcorder, with Zweig using a mirror to record his own experiences. ==Film festivals== The film was selected to the 2004 Hot Docs Canadian International Documentary Festival and received a Silver Hugo at the 2005 Chicago International Film Festival.
